turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1976 Stanley Cup Finals.
turn.1: What was the event 1976 Stanley Cup Finals?
turn.2: 1976 Stanley Cup Finals The 1976 Stanley Cup Finals was the championship series of the National Hockey League's (NHL) 1975–76 season, and the culmination of the 1976 Stanley Cup playoffs.
turn.4: It was contested by the defending champion Philadelphia Flyers, making their third consecutive finals appearance, and the Montreal Canadiens.
turn.5: Was this the first time the Canadiens participated in the Final?
turn.6: This was the Canadiens first appearance in the Final since their Cup win in .
turn.8: The Canadiens would win the best-of-seven series, four games to none.
turn.9: Who did the Canadiens play in the first round?
turn.10: Montreal defeated the Chicago Black Hawks 4–0 and the New York Islanders 4–1 to advance to the final.
turn.11: Who did the Flyers play in the first round?
turn.12: Philadelphia defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs 4–3 and the Boston Bruins 4–1 to make it to the final.
